quotes.quote: Perhaps you notice how the denial is so often the preface to the justification.
Delay is the deadliest form of denial.
The thing about denial is that it doesn't feel like denial when it's going on.
When denial is in play, a person simply refuses to recognize the truth, no matter how apparent.
Denial is the lid on our emotional pressure cooker: the longer we leave it on, the more pressure we build up. Sooner or later, that pressure is bound to pop the lid, and we have an emotional crisis.
Denial is a common tactic that substitutes deliberate ignorance for thoughtful planning.
Clouds cannot cover secret places, nor denials conceal truth.

Denial does not solve the problem. Denial does not make the problem go away. Denial does not give us peace of mind, which is what we are really seeking when we engage in it. Denial is a liar. It compounds the problem, because it keeps us from seeing a solution, and taking action to resolve it.
Never underestimate the power of denial.
The abuse dies in a day, but the denial slays the life of the people, and entombs the hope of the race.
Denial is the number one aspect of medicine. That's why people don't get check-ups.
That which is denied cannot be healed.
God's delay is not God's denial.
The greatest barrier to someone achieving their potential is their denial of it.
Denial of one appetite sharpens the others.
It takes a lot of courage to face up to things you can't do because we feed ourselves so much denial.
Denial is a very powerful thing.
Remember to be honest with yourself. Denial is how we often get stuck in the same place in life.
Denial is the way we handle what we cannot handle.
I think denial's fascinating. It's a jokey word, but it really happens, and sometimes in enormous ways.
The greatest barrier to someone achieving their potential is their denial of it.
More people would learn from their mistakes if they weren't so busy denying them.
Denial is the worst form of truth.
Denial is useful defense mechanism until it's not.
Denial does not change reality for everyone else. Only for the one denying and those who are foolish enough to believe the fantasy.
Being in denial never resolved any problem for anyone, anywhere.
No denial of the truth will ever invalidate it.
At first, they'll only dislike what you say, but the more correct you start sounding the more they'll dislike you.
Denial is the worst kind of lie...because it is the lie you tell yourself.
Denial and inactivity prepare people well for the roles of victim and corpse.
Living in denial only makes accepting the truth that much harder.
As the fear of God is the beginning of wisdom, so the denial of God is the height of foolisnes.
Refusal to believe until proof is given is a rational position; denial of all outside of our own limited experience is absurd.
The worst lies are the lies we tell ourselves. We live in denial of what we do, even what we think. We do this because we're afraid.
Denial ain't just a river in Egypt.
Most men would rather deny a hard truth than face it.
The easiest way to solve a problem is to deny it exists.
Better a friendly denial than unwilling compliance.
It is not necessary to deny another's reality in order to affirm your own.
One picture is worth 1,000 denials.
Denial, perhaps, is a necessary human mechanism to cope with the heartaches of life.
The road of denial leads to the precipice of destruction.
What state do you live in? Denial.
Underneath all that denial, you're someone who's deeply, deeply nice.
Denial is an ugly thing.
Denial, they say, stands for  Don't even notice I am lying.  Human beings are the only animals who are happily lied to by our own minds about what is actually happening around us.
I would rather have regrets of excess than regrets of denial.
Denial is a wall in which love hides behind.
Self-denial is indulgence of a propensity to forego.

The denial of our duty to act in this case is a denial of our right to act; and if we have no right to act, then may we well be termed the white slaves of the North, for like our brethren in bonds, we must seal our lips in silence and despair.
Those who deny the existence of the truth postulate the truth of their denial and plainly contradict themselves.
The only atheism is the denial of truth.
I find I am constantly being encouraged to pluck out some one aspect of myself and present this as the meaningful whole, eclipsing or denying the other parts of self.
It's not denial. I'm just selective about the reality I accept.
Denial helps us to pace our feelings of grief. There is a grace in denial. It is nature's way of letting in only as much as we can handle.
Deny any part of Reality, and you will lose your awareness of all of It.
You can't get away from yourself by moving from one place to another.
